Imba.desc: Imba is the namespace for all runtime related utilities
Imba.html: Imba is the namespace for all runtime related utilities

Imba.isClient.name: isClient
Imba.isClient.desc: True if running in client environment.

Imba.isServer.name: isServer
Imba.isServer.desc: True if running in server environment.

Imba.iterable.name: iterable
Imba.iterable.desc:
Lightweight method for making an object iterable in imbas for/in loops.
If the compiler cannot say for certain that a target in a for loop is an
array, it will cache the iterable version before looping.

```imba
# this is the whole method
def Imba.iterable o
	return o ? (o:toArray ? o.toArray : o) : []

class CustomIterable
	def toArray
		[1,2,3]

# will return [2,4,6]
for x in CustomIterable.new
	x * 2

```
Imba.iterable.html:
Lightweight method for making an object iterable in imbas for/in loops. If the compiler cannot say for certain that a target in a for loop is an array, it will cache the iterable version before looping.

# this is the whole method def Imba.iterable o return o ? (o:toArray ? o.toArray : o) : [] class CustomIterable def toArray [1,2,3] # will return [2,4,6] for x in CustomIterable.new x * 2

Imba.await.name: await
Imba.await.desc:
Coerces a value into a promise. If value is array it will
call `Promise.all(value)`, or if it is not a promise it will
wrap the value in `Promise.resolve(value)`. Used for experimental
await syntax.
Imba.await.html: Coerces a value into a promise. If value is array it will call Promise.all(value), or if it is not a promise it will wrap the value in Promise.resolve(value). Used for experimental await syntax.

Imba.Touch.desc:
Consolidates mouse and touch events. Touch objects persist across a touch,
from touchstart until end/cancel. When a touch starts, it will traverse
down from the innermost target, until it finds a node that responds to
ontouchstart. Unless the touch is explicitly redirected, the touch will
call ontouchmove and ontouchend / ontouchcancel on the responder when appropriate.

	tag draggable
		# called when a touch starts
		def ontouchstart touch
			flag 'dragging'
			self
		
		# called when touch moves - same touch object
		def ontouchmove touch
			# move the node with touch
			css top: touch.dy, left: touch.dx
		
		# called when touch ends
		def ontouchend touch
			unflag 'dragging'
Imba.Touch.html:
Consolidates mouse and touch events. Touch objects persist across a touch, from touchstart until end/cancel. When a touch starts, it will traverse down from the innermost target, until it finds a node that responds to ontouchstart. Unless the touch is explicitly redirected, the touch will call ontouchmove and ontouchend / ontouchcancel on the responder when appropriate.

tag draggable # called when a touch starts def ontouchstart touch flag 'dragging' self # called when touch moves - same touch object def ontouchmove touch # move the node with touch css top: touch.dy, left: touch.dx # called when touch ends def ontouchend touch unflag 'dragging'

Imba.Touch#extend.name: extend
Imba.Touch#extend.desc:
Extend the touch with a plugin / gesture. 
All events (touchstart,move etc) for the touch
will be triggered on the plugins in the order they
are added.
Imba.Touch#extend.html: Extend the touch with a plugin / gesture. All events (touchstart,move etc) for the touch will be triggered on the plugins in the order they are added.

Imba.Touch#redirect.name: redirect
Imba.Touch#redirect.desc:
Redirect touch to specified target. ontouchstart will always be
called on the new target.
Imba.Touch#redirect.html: Redirect touch to specified target. ontouchstart will always be called on the new target.

Imba.Touch#suppress.name: suppress
Imba.Touch#suppress.desc:
Suppress the default behaviour. Will call preventDefault for
all native events that are part of the touch.
Imba.Touch#suppress.html: Suppress the default behaviour. Will call preventDefault for all native events that are part of the touch.

Imba.Touch#dr.name: dr
Imba.Touch#dr.desc: The absolute distance the touch has moved from starting position
Imba.Touch#dr.html: The absolute distance the touch has moved from starting position

Imba.Touch#dx.name: dx
Imba.Touch#dx.desc: The distance the touch has moved horizontally
Imba.Touch#dx.html: The distance the touch has moved horizontally

Imba.Touch#dy.name: dy
Imba.Touch#dy.desc: The distance the touch has moved vertically
Imba.Touch#dy.html: The distance the touch has moved vertically

Imba.Touch#tx.name: tx
Imba.Touch#tx.desc: Horizontal position of touch relative to target
Imba.Touch#tx.html: Horizontal position of touch relative to target

Imba.Touch#ty.name: ty
Imba.Touch#ty.desc: Vertical position of touch relative to target
Imba.Touch#ty.html: Vertical position of touch relative to target

Imba.Touch#button.name: button
Imba.Touch#button.desc: Button pressed in this touch. Native touches defaults to left-click (0)
Imba.Touch#button.html: Button pressed in this touch. Native touches defaults to left-click (0)

Imba.Event.desc:
Imba handles all events in the dom through a single manager,
listening at the root of your document. If Imba finds a tag
that listens to a certain event, the event will be wrapped 
in an `Imba.Event`, which normalizes some of the quirks and 
browser differences.
Imba.Event.html: Imba handles all events in the dom through a single manager, listening at the root of your document. If Imba finds a tag that listens to a certain event, the event will be wrapped in an Imba.Event, which normalizes some of the quirks and browser differences.

Imba.Event#halt.name: halt
Imba.Event#halt.desc: Prevents further propagation of the current event.
Imba.Event#halt.html: Prevents further propagation of the current event.

Imba.Event#cancel.name: cancel
Imba.Event#cancel.desc:
Cancel the event (if cancelable). In the case of native events it
will call `preventDefault` on the wrapped event object.
Imba.Event#cancel.html: Cancel the event (if cancelable). In the case of native events it will call preventDefault on the wrapped event object.

Imba.Event#isPrevented.name: isPrevented
Imba.Event#isPrevented.desc: Indicates whether or not event.cancel has been called.
Imba.Event#isPrevented.html: Indicates whether or not event.cancel has been called.

Imba.Event#target.name: target
Imba.Event#target.desc: A reference to the initial target of the event.
Imba.Event#target.html: A reference to the initial target of the event.

Imba.Event#responder.name: responder
Imba.Event#responder.desc: A reference to the object responding to the event.
Imba.Event#responder.html: A reference to the object responding to the event.

Imba.Event#redirect.name: redirect
Imba.Event#redirect.desc: Redirect the event to new target

Imba.Event#keychar.name: keychar
Imba.Event#keychar.desc: Get the normalized character for KeyboardEvent/TextEvent

Imba.Event#x.name: x
Imba.Event#x.desc: Return the x/left coordinate of the mouse / pointer for this event

return.name: return
return.desc: x coordinate of mouse / pointer for event

Imba.Event#x.html: Return the x/left coordinate of the mouse / pointer for this event

Imba.Event#y.name: y
Imba.Event#y.desc: Return the y/top coordinate of the mouse / pointer for this event

return.name: return
return.desc: y coordinate of mouse / pointer for event

Imba.Event#y.html: Return the y/top coordinate of the mouse / pointer for this event

Imba.Event#which.name: which
Imba.Event#which.desc:
Returns a Number representing a system and implementation
dependent numeric code identifying the unmodified value of the
pressed key; this is usually the same as keyCode.

For mouse-events, the returned value indicates which button was
pressed on the mouse to trigger the event.
Imba.Event#which.html:
Returns a Number representing a system and implementation dependent numeric code identifying the unmodified value of the pressed key; this is usually the same as keyCode.

For mouse-events, the returned value indicates which button was pressed on the mouse to trigger the event.

Imba.EventManager.desc:
Manager for listening to and delegating events in Imba. A single instance
is always created by Imba (as `Imba.Events`), which handles and delegates all
events at the very root of the document. Imba does not capture all events
by default, so if you want to make sure exotic or custom DOMEvents are delegated
in Imba you will need to register them in `Imba.Events.register(myCustomEventName)`
Imba.EventManager.html: Manager for listening to and delegating events in Imba. A single instance is always created by Imba (as Imba.Events), which handles and delegates all events at the very root of the document. Imba does not capture all events by default, so if you want to make sure exotic or custom DOMEvents are delegated in Imba you will need to register them in Imba.Events.register(myCustomEventName)

Imba.EventManager#register.name: register
Imba.EventManager#register.desc:
Tell the current EventManager to intercept and handle event of a certain name.
By default, Imba.Events will register interceptors for: *keydown*, *keyup*, 
*keypress*, *textInput*, *input*, *change*, *submit*, *focusin*, *focusout*, 
*blur*, *contextmenu*, *dblclick*, *mousewheel*, *wheel*
Imba.EventManager#register.html: Tell the current EventManager to intercept and handle event of a certain name. By default, Imba.Events will register interceptors for: keydown, keyup, keypress, textInput, input, change, submit, focusin, focusout, blur, contextmenu, dblclick, mousewheel, wheel

Imba.Tag.desc: This is the baseclass that all tags in imba inherit from.
Imba.Tag.html: This is the baseclass that all tags in imba inherit from.

Imba.Tag#setRef.name: setRef
Imba.Tag#setRef.desc:
Setting references for tags like
`<div@header>` will compile to `tag('div').setRef('header',this).end()`
By default it adds the reference as a className to the tag.
Imba.Tag#setRef.html: Setting references for tags like <div@header> will compile to tag('div').setRef('header',this).end() By default it adds the reference as a className to the tag.

Imba.Tag#setHandler.name: setHandler
Imba.Tag#setHandler.desc:
Method that is called by the compiled tag-chains, for
binding events on tags to methods etc.
`<a :tap=fn>` compiles to `tag('a').setHandler('tap',fn,this).end()`
where this refers to the context in which the tag is created.
Imba.Tag#setHandler.html: Method that is called by the compiled tag-chains, for binding events on tags to methods etc. <a :tap=fn> compiles to tag('a').setHandler('tap',fn,this).end() where this refers to the context in which the tag is created.

Imba.Tag#setAttribute.name: setAttribute
Imba.Tag#setAttribute.desc:
Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an existing attribute
on the specified tag. If the value is null or false, the attribute
will be removed.
Imba.Tag#setAttribute.html: Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an existing attribute on the specified tag. If the value is null or false, the attribute will be removed.

Imba.Tag#removeAttribute.name: removeAttribute
Imba.Tag#removeAttribute.desc: removes an attribute from the specified tag
Imba.Tag#removeAttribute.html: removes an attribute from the specified tag

Imba.Tag#getAttribute.name: getAttribute
Imba.Tag#getAttribute.desc:
returns the value of an attribute on the tag.
If the given attribute does not exist, the value returned
will either be null or "" (the empty string)
Imba.Tag#getAttribute.html: returns the value of an attribute on the tag. If the given attribute does not exist, the value returned will either be null or "" (the empty string)

Imba.Tag#setContent.name: setContent
Imba.Tag#setContent.desc: Override this to provide special wrapping etc.
Imba.Tag#setContent.html: Override this to provide special wrapping etc.

Imba.Tag#setChildren.name: setChildren
Imba.Tag#setChildren.desc:
Set the children of node. type param is optional,
and should only be used by Imba when compiling tag trees.
Imba.Tag#setChildren.html: Set the children of node. type param is optional, and should only be used by Imba when compiling tag trees.

Imba.Tag#removeChild.name: removeChild
Imba.Tag#removeChild.desc: Remove specified child from current node.

Imba.Tag#remove.name: remove
Imba.Tag#remove.desc: Remove specified child from current node.

Imba.Tag#appendChild.name: appendChild
Imba.Tag#appendChild.desc:
Append a single item (node or string) to the current node.
If supplied item is a string it will automatically. This is used
by Imba internally, but will practically never be used explicitly.
Imba.Tag#appendChild.html: Append a single item (node or string) to the current node. If supplied item is a string it will automatically. This is used by Imba internally, but will practically never be used explicitly.

Imba.Tag#insertBefore.name: insertBefore
Imba.Tag#insertBefore.desc:
Insert a node into the current node (self), before another.
The relative node must be a child of current node.
Imba.Tag#insertBefore.html: Insert a node into the current node (self), before another. The relative node must be a child of current node.

Imba.Tag#append.name: append
Imba.Tag#append.desc:
The .append method inserts the specified content as the last child
of the target node. If the content is already a child of node it
will be moved to the end.

# example
    var root = <div.root>
    var item = <div.item> "This is an item"
    root.append item # appends item to the end of root

    root.prepend "some text" # append text
    root.prepend [<ul>,<ul>] # append array
Imba.Tag#append.html:
The .append method inserts the specified content as the last child of the target node. If the content is already a child of node it will be moved to the end.

example

var root = <div.root> var item = <div.item> "This is an item" root.append item # appends item to the end of root root.prepend "some text" # append text root.prepend [<ul>,<ul>] # append array

Imba.Tag#prepend.name: prepend
Imba.Tag#prepend.desc:
The .prepend method inserts the specified content as the first
child of the target node. If the content is already a child of 
node it will be moved to the start.

    	node.prepend <div.top> # prepend node
    	node.prepend "some text" # prepend text
    	node.prepend [<ul>,<ul>] # prepend array
Imba.Tag#prepend.todo: Should support multiple arguments like append
Imba.Tag#prepend.html:
The .prepend method inserts the specified content as the first child of the target node. If the content is already a child of node it will be moved to the start.

node.prepend <div.top> # prepend node node.prepend "some text" # prepend text node.prepend [<ul>,<ul>] # prepend array

Imba.Tag#orphanize.name: orphanize
Imba.Tag#orphanize.desc: Remove node from the dom tree

Imba.Tag#text.name: text
Imba.Tag#text.desc:
Get text of node. Uses textContent behind the scenes (not innerText)
[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent]()
Imba.Tag#text.html: Get text of node. Uses textContent behind the scenes (not innerText) https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent

Imba.Tag#text=.name: text=
Imba.Tag#text=.desc:
Set text of node. Uses textContent behind the scenes (not innerText)
[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent]()
Imba.Tag#text=.html: Set text of node. Uses textContent behind the scenes (not innerText) https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent

Imba.Tag#dataset.name: dataset
Imba.Tag#dataset.desc:
Method for getting and setting data-attributes. When called with zero
arguments it will return the actual dataset for the tag.

	var node = <div data-name='hello'>
	# get the whole dataset
	node.dataset # {name: 'hello'}
	# get a single value
	node.dataset('name') # 'hello'
	# set a single value
	node.dataset('name','newname') # self
Imba.Tag#dataset.html:
Method for getting and setting data-attributes. When called with zero arguments it will return the actual dataset for the tag.

var node = <div data-name='hello'> # get the whole dataset node.dataset # {name: 'hello'} # get a single value node.dataset('name') # 'hello' # set a single value node.dataset('name','newname') # self

Imba.Tag#render.name: render
Imba.Tag#render.desc:
Empty placeholder. Override to implement custom render behaviour.
Works much like the familiar render-method in React.
Imba.Tag#render.html: Empty placeholder. Override to implement custom render behaviour. Works much like the familiar render-method in React.

Imba.Tag#build.name: build
Imba.Tag#build.desc:
Called implicitly through Imba.Tag#end, upon creating a tag. All
properties will have been set before build is called, including
setContent.
Imba.Tag#build.html: Called implicitly through Imba.Tag#end, upon creating a tag. All properties will have been set before build is called, including setContent.

Imba.Tag#commit.name: commit
Imba.Tag#commit.desc:
Called implicitly through Imba.Tag#end, for tags that are part of
a tag tree (that are rendered several times).
Imba.Tag#commit.html: Called implicitly through Imba.Tag#end, for tags that are part of a tag tree (that are rendered several times).

Imba.Tag#tick.name: tick
Imba.Tag#tick.desc:
Called by the tag-scheduler (if this tag is scheduled)
By default it will call this.render. Do not override unless
you really understand it.
Imba.Tag#tick.html: Called by the tag-scheduler (if this tag is scheduled) By default it will call this.render. Do not override unless you really understand it.

Imba.Tag#end.name: end
Imba.Tag#end.desc:
A very important method that you will practically never manually.
The tag syntax of Imba compiles to a chain of setters, which always
ends with .end. `<a.large>` compiles to `tag('a').flag('large').end()`

You are highly adviced to not override its behaviour. The first time
end is called it will mark the tag as built and call Imba.Tag#build,
and call Imba.Tag#commit on subsequent calls.
Imba.Tag#end.html:
A very important method that you will practically never manually. The tag syntax of Imba compiles to a chain of setters, which always ends with .end. <a.large> compiles to tag('a').flag('large').end()

You are highly adviced to not override its behaviour. The first time end is called it will mark the tag as built and call Imba.Tag#build, and call Imba.Tag#commit on subsequent calls.

Imba.Tag#synced.name: synced
Imba.Tag#synced.desc:
This is called instead of Imba.Tag#end for `<self>` tag chains.
Defaults to noop
Imba.Tag#synced.html: This is called instead of Imba.Tag#end for <self> tag chains. Defaults to noop

Imba.Tag#flags.name: flags
Imba.Tag#flags.desc: List of flags for this node.

Imba.Tag#flag.name: flag
Imba.Tag#flag.desc:
Add speficied flag to current node.
If a second argument is supplied, it will be coerced into a Boolean,
and used to indicate whether we should remove the flag instead.
Imba.Tag#flag.html: Add speficied flag to current node. If a second argument is supplied, it will be coerced into a Boolean, and used to indicate whether we should remove the flag instead.

Imba.Tag#hasFlag.name: hasFlag
Imba.Tag#hasFlag.desc: Check whether current node has specified flag
Imba.Tag#hasFlag.html: Check whether current node has specified flag

Imba.Tag#setFlag.name: setFlag
Imba.Tag#setFlag.desc:
Set/update a named flag. It remembers the previous
value of the flag, and removes it before setting the new value.
```imba
node.setFlag('type','todo')
node.setFlag('type','project')
# todo is removed, project is added.
```
Imba.Tag#setFlag.html:
Set/update a named flag. It remembers the previous value of the flag, and removes it before setting the new value.

node.setFlag('type','todo') node.setFlag('type','project') # todo is removed, project is added.

Imba.Tag#scheduler.name: scheduler
Imba.Tag#scheduler.desc:
Get the scheduler for this node. A new scheduler will be created
if it does not already exist.
Imba.Tag#scheduler.html: Get the scheduler for this node. A new scheduler will be created if it does not already exist.

Imba.Tag#schedule.name: schedule
Imba.Tag#schedule.desc:
Shorthand to start scheduling a node. The method will basically
proxy the arguments through to scheduler.configure, and then
activate the scheduler.
Imba.Tag#schedule.html: Shorthand to start scheduling a node. The method will basically proxy the arguments through to scheduler.configure, and then activate the scheduler.

Imba.Tag#unschedule.name: unschedule
Imba.Tag#unschedule.desc: Shorthand for deactivating scheduler (if tag has one).
Imba.Tag#unschedule.html: Shorthand for deactivating scheduler (if tag has one).

Imba.Tag#parent.name: parent
Imba.Tag#parent.desc: Get the parent of current node

Imba.Tag#next.name: next
Imba.Tag#next.desc: Get the immediately following sibling of node.
Imba.Tag#next.html: Get the immediately following sibling of node.

Imba.Tag#prev.name: prev
Imba.Tag#prev.desc: Get the immediately preceeding sibling of node.
Imba.Tag#prev.html: Get the immediately preceeding sibling of node.

Imba.Tag#find.name: find
Imba.Tag#find.desc: Get descendants of current node, optionally matching selector
Imba.Tag#find.html: Get descendants of current node, optionally matching selector

Imba.Tag#first.name: first
Imba.Tag#first.desc: Get the first matching child of node
Imba.Tag#first.html: Get the first matching child of node

Imba.Tag#last.name: last
Imba.Tag#last.desc:
Get the last matching child of node

	node.last # returns the last child of node
	node.last %span # returns the last span inside node
	node.last do |el| el.text == 'Hi' # return last node with text Hi
Imba.Tag#last.html:
Get the last matching child of node

node.last # returns the last child of node node.last %span # returns the last span inside node node.last do |el| el.text == 'Hi' # return last node with text Hi

Imba.Tag#matches.name: matches
Imba.Tag#matches.desc: Check if this node matches a selector
Imba.Tag#matches.html: Check if this node matches a selector

Imba.Tag#closest.name: closest
Imba.Tag#closest.desc:
Get the first element matching supplied selector / filter
traversing upwards, but including the node itself.
Imba.Tag#closest.html: Get the first element matching supplied selector / filter traversing upwards, but including the node itself.

Imba.Tag#up.name: up
Imba.Tag#up.desc:
Get the closest ancestor of node that matches
specified selector / matcher.
Imba.Tag#up.html: Get the closest ancestor of node that matches specified selector / matcher.

Imba.Tag#contains.name: contains
Imba.Tag#contains.desc: Check if node contains other node

Imba.schedule.name: schedule
Imba.schedule.desc:
Global alternative to requestAnimationFrame. Schedule a target
to tick every frame. You can specify which method to call on the
target (defaults to tick).
Imba.schedule.html: Global alternative to requestAnimationFrame. Schedule a target to tick every frame. You can specify which method to call on the target (defaults to tick).

Imba.setTimeout.name: setTimeout
Imba.setTimeout.desc:
Light wrapper around native setTimeout that expects the block / function
as last argument (instead of first). It also triggers an event to Imba
after the timeout to let schedulers update (to rerender etc) afterwards.
Imba.setTimeout.html: Light wrapper around native setTimeout that expects the block / function as last argument (instead of first). It also triggers an event to Imba after the timeout to let schedulers update (to rerender etc) afterwards.

Imba.setInterval.name: setInterval
Imba.setInterval.desc:
Light wrapper around native setInterval that expects the block / function
as last argument (instead of first). It also triggers an event to Imba
after every interval to let schedulers update (to rerender etc) afterwards.
Imba.setInterval.html: Light wrapper around native setInterval that expects the block / function as last argument (instead of first). It also triggers an event to Imba after every interval to let schedulers update (to rerender etc) afterwards.

Imba.Scheduler.desc:
Instances of Imba.Scheduler manages when to call `tick()` on their target,
at a specified framerate or when certain events occur. Root-nodes in your
applications will usually have a scheduler to make sure they rerender when
something changes. It is also possible to make inner components use their
own schedulers to control when they render.
Imba.Scheduler.html: Instances of Imba.Scheduler manages when to call tick() on their target, at a specified framerate or when certain events occur. Root-nodes in your applications will usually have a scheduler to make sure they rerender when something changes. It is also possible to make inner components use their own schedulers to control when they render.

Imba.Scheduler#initialize.name: initialize
Imba.Scheduler#initialize.desc: Create a new Imba.Scheduler for specified target
Imba.Scheduler#initialize.html: Create a new Imba.Scheduler for specified target

Imba.Scheduler#active.name: active
Imba.Scheduler#active.desc: Check whether the current scheduler is active or not
Imba.Scheduler#active.html: Check whether the current scheduler is active or not

Imba.Scheduler#dt.name: dt
Imba.Scheduler#dt.desc: Delta time between the two last ticks
Imba.Scheduler#dt.html: Delta time between the two last ticks

Imba.Scheduler#mark.name: mark
Imba.Scheduler#mark.desc:
Mark the scheduler as dirty. This will make sure that
the scheduler calls `target.tick` on the next frame
Imba.Scheduler#mark.html: Mark the scheduler as dirty. This will make sure that the scheduler calls target.tick on the next frame

Imba.Scheduler#flush.name: flush
Imba.Scheduler#flush.desc:
Instantly trigger target.tick and mark scheduler as clean (not dirty/marked).
This is called implicitly from tick, but can also be called manually if you
really want to force a tick without waiting for the next frame.
Imba.Scheduler#flush.html: Instantly trigger target.tick and mark scheduler as clean (not dirty/marked). This is called implicitly from tick, but can also be called manually if you really want to force a tick without waiting for the next frame.

Imba.Scheduler#tick.name: tick
Imba.Scheduler#tick.desc:
Called automatically on every frame while the scheduler is active.
It will only call `target.tick` if the scheduler is marked dirty,
or when according to @fps setting.

If you have set up a scheduler with an fps of 1, tick will still be
called every frame, but `target.tick` will only be called once every
second, and it will *make sure* each `target.tick` happens in separate
seconds according to Date. So if you have a node that renders a clock
based on Date.now (or something similar), you can schedule it with 1fps,
never needing to worry about two ticks happening within the same second.
The same goes for 4fps, 10fps etc.
Imba.Scheduler#tick.fixme: this expects raf to run at 60 fps
Imba.Scheduler#tick.html:
Called automatically on every frame while the scheduler is active. It will only call target.tick if the scheduler is marked dirty, or when according to @fps setting.

If you have set up a scheduler with an fps of 1, tick will still be called every frame, but target.tick will only be called once every second, and it will make sure each target.tick happens in separate seconds according to Date. So if you have a node that renders a clock based on Date.now (or something similar), you can schedule it with 1fps, never needing to worry about two ticks happening within the same second. The same goes for 4fps, 10fps etc.

Imba.Scheduler#activate.name: activate
Imba.Scheduler#activate.desc:
Start the scheduler if it is not already active.
**While active**, the scheduler will override `target.commit`
to do nothing. By default Imba.tag#commit calls render, so
that rendering is cascaded through to children when rendering
a node. When a scheduler is active (for a node), Imba disables
this automatic rendering.

Imba.Scheduler#deactivate.name: deactivate
Imba.Scheduler#deactivate.desc: Stop the scheduler if it is active.
Imba.Scheduler#deactivate.html: Stop the scheduler if it is active.
